Method Detail

newFileGrp

public FileGrp newFileGrp()
                   throws METSException
Return an empty FileGrp. The returned object has no properties or content and is not part of the METS document, it is essentially a constructor of a METS element which is owned by the METS document. The returned object needs to be "filled out" (e.g. with id, additional sub-elements, etc) before being added to the METS document.

Throws:
METSException

getFileGrpByUse

public java.util.List<FileGrp> getFileGrpByUse(java.lang.String use)
                                        throws METSException
Obtain the child fileGrp with the USE provided

Parameters:
use - a USE string
Returns:
List FileGrps having a USE attribute value matching the use passed in. If not found an empty list is returned.
Throws:
METSException

addFileGrp

public FileGrp addFileGrp(FileGrp fileGrp)
Add a fileGrp

Parameters:
fileGrp - a FileGrp object
Returns:
FileGrp Any existing fileGrp having an ID attribute value matching the id of the fileGrp provided. If an entry does not exist null is returned.

removeFileGrp

public FileGrp removeFileGrp(java.lang.String id)
Remove a fileGrp with the ID provided

Parameters:
id - the id of the fileGrp to remove
Returns:
FileGrp The deleted fileGrp. If an entry does not exist null is returned.

Parameters:

public File getFile(java.lang.String id)
             throws METSException

Parameters:
id - an ID string
Returns:
File The file having an ID attribute value matching the id passed in. If not found null is returned.
Throws:
METSException

refresh

public void refresh()
             throws METSException
Refreshes the file list cache. Should be called whenever files are added or removed to ensure cache is up to date.

Throws:
METSException
